Hi Mark,

> just poking through my logs to see what information was 
> reported there and came across the stuff below. This looks 
> like an attempt at a buffer overflow attack. Are there any 
> known jetty venerabilities?

OSVDB reports that DoS attacks are possible on Jetty 4.2.18 and lower.
More info at http://www.osvdb.org/displayvuln.php?osvdb_id=4387.
We are using Jetty 4.2.17 and we should upgrade to the latest stable version (4.2.21).
Also, there is some mention of CGI security problems in early versions 
(http://groups.yahoo.com/group/jetty-announce/message/45)
We don't have Jetty configured to run CGI except if it is a default setting, which I doubt. Even 
though it is not an issue anymore we will take a look at it.

Take care.
i.

> 
> cheers

> mark
